alert.note: Alert for Chariton; Cooper; Howard; Pettis; Randolph; Saline (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Randolph, southeastern Chariton, eastern Pettis, Howard, eastern Saline and Cooper Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Franklin, or near Boonville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moberly, Boonville, Fayette, Slater, Glasgow, New Franklin, Pilot Grove, Smithton, Higbee, Otterville, Bunceton, Clark, Armstrong, Prairie Home, Gilliam, Nelson, Renick, Blackwater, Franklin and Wooldridge. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 80 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Chariton; Cooper; Howard; Pettis; Randolph; Saline
